definitions.text: a fine cord of twisted fibers (of cotton or silk or wool or nylon etc.) used in sewing and weaving
any long object resembling a thin line
examples: from the air the road was a grey thread
a thread of smoke climbed upward

definitions.text: the connections that link the various parts of an event or argument together
examples: I couldn't follow his train of thought
he lost the thread of his argument

definitions.text: the raised helical rib going around a screw
to move or cause to move in a sinuous, spiral, or circular course
examples: the river winds through the hills
the path meanders through the vineyards
sometimes, the gout wanders through the entire body

definitions.text: remove facial hair by tying a fine string around it and pulling at the string
thread on or as if on a string
examples: the child drew glass beads on a string
